text.section: In this subtitle the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Mineral interest" means an interest in a mineral estate, however created and regardless of form, whether absolute or fractional, divided or undivided, corporeal or incorporeal, including a fee simple or any lesser interest or any kind of royalty, production payment, executive right, nonexecutive right, leasehold, or lien in minerals, regardless of character.
"Severed mineral interest" means a mineral interest that is severed from the interest in the surface estate overlying the mineral interest.
"Surface estate" means an interest in the estate overlying a mineral interest.

section.section: "Surface owner" means any person vested with a whole or undivided fee simple interest or other freehold interest in the surface estate.
"Surface owner" does not include the owner of a right-of-way, easement, or leasehold on the surface estate.

"Unknown or missing owner" means any person vested with a severed mineral interest whose present identity or location cannot be determined:
From the records of the county where the severed mineral interest is located; or
By diligent inquiry in the vicinity of the owner's last known place of residence.
"Unknown or missing owner" includes the heirs, successors, or assignees of an unknown or missing owner.
